sources.title: Sur les Toits
sources.description: On the Roof (French: Sur les Toits; Star Film Catalogue no. 100) is a 1897 French short black-and-white silent comedy film, directed by Georges Méliès, featuring the director as a bumbling policeman attempting to apprehend two criminals on the roof of an apartment building. "Every second of this," "highly successfully staged" "minute of film," according to Europa Film Treasues, "is used to construct the character's action and movements" and "made use of the theatre's three-dimensional decor," which "the competition quickly copied." Country: France Also Known As: On the Roofs Production Co: Star-Film Star Film Catalogue no. 100

metadata.Plot: Numbered 100 in the rich catalogues of Méliès's Star Film Company, this lively farce portrays a hapless woman's cry for help, as two cat burglars atop the steep and tiled rooftops attempt to break into her house. From afar, a zealous policeman hears the woman in distress and tries to pursue the criminals on the slippery roofs, nevertheless, is he qualified for the job?
